defitem.label: Funding:
defitem.item: Web version of the finding aid funded in part by a grant from the National Endowment for the Humanities.

archdesc.runner: Special Collections and Archives, James Branch Cabell Library, Virginia Commonwealth University

did.head: Descriptive Summary
did.repository: Special Collections and Archives, James Branch Cabell Library, Virginia Commonwealth University

accessrestrict.head: Access
accessrestrict.p: The correspondence files are restricted until 2012 unless the researcher has written permission from Dr. Nagel or his executor.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Box/folder, Paul C. Nagel Papers, M 255, Special Collections and Archives, James Branch Cabell Library, Virginia Commonwealth University

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: The materials were donated to the Department by Dr. Nagel in insallments beginning in 1987.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Collection processed in 1987 and revised in 1989, 1990 and 1992.

bioghist.head: Biographical/Historical Information
bioghist.p: Paul C. Nagel was a historian.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Information
scopecontent.p: The collection contains materials relating to Dr. Nagel's professional and literary career including teaching, administration and drafts of his books. The bulk of the collection relates to the development, research and publication of Nagel's work on the Adams and Lee families.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Collection is arranged alphabetically within each series.

arrangement.head: Organization
arrangement.p:
Series I--Lecture and Teaching Materials (-)
Series II--Descent from Glory (-)
Series III--Other Papers, Books and Speeches by Nagel (-)
Series IV--Articles by Others sent to PCN (-)
Series V--Reviews (-)
Series VI--Correspondence (-)
Series VII--The Adams Women (-)
Series VIII--George Caleb Bingham (-)
Series IX--Lee Book (-); Restricted Correspondence (-)
